content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <metadata>  <idinfo>   <citation>    <citeinfo>     <origin>Laurie Gregory, laurie.gregory@bnl.gov</origin>     <origin>Lynn Ma, malynn@bnl.gov</origin>     <origin>Richard Wagener, wagener@bnl.gov</origin>     <origin>Mark Klassen, markk@ops.sgp.arm.gov</origin>     <title>Cimel Sunphotometer </title>     <pubdate>20100316</pubdate>     <onlink>http://www.arm.gov/instruments/csphot </onlink>     <onlink>http://www.arm.gov</onlink>     <onlink>http://www.arm.gov/instruments</onlink>    </citeinfo>   </citation>   <descript>    <abstract> The Cimel sunphotometer (CSPHOT) is a multi-channel, automatic sun-and-sky scanning radiometer that measures the direct solar irradiance and sky radiance at the Earth's surface. Measurements are taken at pre-determined discrete wavelengths in the visible a nd near-IR parts of the spectrum to determine atmospheric transmission and scattering properties. This instrument is weather-proof and requires little maintenance during periods of adverse weather conditions. It takes measurements only during daylight hour s (sun above horizon). </abstract>    <supplinf> csphot handbook is available at: http//www.arm.gov/publications/tech_reports/handbooks/csphot_handbook.pdf</supplinf>   </descript>   <timeperd>    <timeinfo>     <rngdates>      <begdate>06APR1994 </begdate>      <enddate>30SEP2009
